args:
On the day of the play, Marley receives news
that his sister has been saved by Sylas's
aromatics. After being brought back from his
despair, he goes to the theater in time to see
the play's climax, which ends up saving his
and Shelley's hearts.
I know you're in there, Marley.\nPlease listen to me.
I finished your script, and we're putting\non the play this evening.
Please come see the heart that you,\nSylas, and I created.
Welcome back, Laxi. And as you are alone,\nI take it Marley didn't come out?
Correct. But we will not waver.
Oh, I had no plans of doing so.\nCome then. The stage beckons.
I would like to tell all of you gathered\nhere today the story of Fran.
Though she had an artificial body,\na real soul still rested within her.
Allow me to tell you this fantastical tale.\nThe tale of the girl whom I created.\nThe tale...of Fran.
Mr. Marley! Are you here, Mr. Marley?!
That's the woman from the hospital.
No. Please say it isn't happening...
Please, you must come out!\nSomething has happened!
(No! No, I don't want to hear it!\nI don't want to know that she's...)
What is this?! What do you mean?!
Oh, thank goodness you're in!\nHere's what happened...
...So the new aromatics Sylas brought\nactually worked?
Yes. His knowledge of medicinal herbs\nwas such that it even astounded our\nown doctors.
He came to the hospital a few days ago\nsaying he'd made a new aromatic for her.
The moment we started using it,\nher breathing improved!
She's now completely stabilized.\nOh, but it's a miracle. A true miracle!
Sylas made an aromatic just for Shelley?
Er, sorry. When can I see her?
We want to keep an eye on her for now,\nbut you can see her in a few days' time.
That Sylas fellow said that he wanted\nto save both Shelley and you.
He said that losing Shelley would no\ndoubt cost you your heart.
He did. He also said that if you lost your\nheart, he'd never again be able to watch\nthe moment you create a new one.
What in the world is he...?
Please come see the heart that you,\nSylas, and I created.
I'm so sorry, miss, but I have somewhere I\nneed to be. Please come find me when my\nsister is ready to receive visitors.
Fran... FRAN! Open your eyes, Fran!\nYou aren't Carol at allâ€”you're YOU!
I hurt you more than I can say with my\nselfish, single-minded wish to transplant\nCarol's soul.
But I knew you couldn't put the soul of the\ndead into an artificial body. This whole\ntime, I was just running from the truth.
You were born from nothingness.\nYou told me that you loved me.
Yet I somehow could not see that\nfor the miracle it was.
Please, Fran... Please open your eyes...
(This is the climax of my play where\nDr. Schmidt is desperately trying to repair\nFran after she has broken.)
(But I couldn't write anything beyond\nthis. So then...)
Do you know why I was born, Dr. Schmidt?\nBecause you poured your heart into me.
That heart longed to bring Carol back.\nAnd though that may have been all it\nwanted back then...
You eventually started to care about me.
Because of that, I have been reborn.
I can't believe this. It's really you, Fran!\nYou're really here!
Yes. Thanks to your heart,\nmy own heart exists.
And here it will stay, forever and always.
(The script we all brought to life while\nthinking of my sister is done...)
(With all of our hearts and all of our\nstruggles poured into it, this is our story.\nThis is Philosophia's Monster!)
Excuse me, sir, I'm afraid it's closing time.
That was an excellent performance,\nand it makes me ashamed to have\nabandoned my role in it partway through.
You abandoned both this play AND your\nsister in order to hole up in your house.\nYes, you're a real piece of work indeed.
Affirmative. It was mean to scout us and\nthen run away in the middle.
I know, and there's nothing I can say\nto make up for what I've done.
...But...I could see you from the stage,\nand I saw your smile when we finished.
That was the face I wanted to see,\nso that's good enough for me.
And me as well. You're still a piece of\nwork, but I'm happy to see a fellow\ncreator's efforts come to fruition.
Thank you both. I can't believe I nearly\nthrew away everything I cared about.
Stories really can save people, and the\nperformance the two of you just put on\nproves that.
I'm going to stand strong and never run\naway againâ€”not from my sister's illness\nor from the stage!
It's a bit sad to think this is the end.
Do you want to perform it again?
Heh. Well, I would like to.\nâ–·Really, Laxi? I wouldn't have expected\nthat from you!â—
It surprises me too. But by creating\nsomething, I've started to understand\nhow Maestro felt.
Making a heart is fun. And seeing it\ncompleted makes me really happy.
â–·You're rightâ€”and I feel like Maestro\nmust have thought the same way.â—
Listening to you makes me want to finish\nmy little project right away!
The aromatic of my dreams.\nI've been putting my whole heart into it.
You'll be waiting for the day it's finished,\nwon't you?
Yes. Please do so as soon as you can.
Okay, what the hell was THAT?!
â–·Hi, Luca! And, um, what do you mean?â—

That PLAY, man! I was wondering what the
heck was with these tickets that suddenly
arrived, and then what do I find but all of
THIS!
How in the heck did YOU guys get to be\nthe leads in an actual play?!
And also, why didn't you tell me about it?!\nThis thing is crazy elaborateâ€”you've got\nsets and lights and...and EVERYTHING!
No need to get mad. It's so elaborate\nbecause we poured our hearts into it.
Affirmative. And though Halloween may be\nover, we still put our hearts into tricking\nyou in our own way.
Consider it payback for all of your pranks!
